title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet Bing cherries and fluffy whipped cream. Perfectly moist and richly flavored, this cake brings a touch of elegance and nostalgia to any celebration or cozy gathering.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely in pans, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to create four layers total.
Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser to soak the cake.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth.
If filling is too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk to reach spreading consistency.
Spread one-third of the filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries.
Repeat layering with remaining cake layers, filling, and cherries.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake for decoration.
tips: For the best results, ensure your cakes are completely cooled before slicing and soaking with kirschwasser to prevent crumbling. Use fresh heavy cream and whip it just until stiff peaks form to achieve a light, airy frosting. Avoid overmixing the batter to keep the cake tender and moist.

structured_content.content: This Black Forest Cake II is a decadent celebration of rich chocolate and tart cherries, soaked in fragrant Kirsch liqueur. Each bite offers a perfect balance of moist cake, creamy filling, and fresh fruit, making it a timeless dessert that delights the senses and warms the heart.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour prep plus bake time
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home with authentic Kirsch-soaked layers
  • Perfect for special occasions, holiday celebrations, or elegant dinner parties
  • Uses simple pantry staples and canned cherries for convenience
  • The combination of chocolate, cherry, and whipped cream creates a classic flavor trio loved by many

structured_content.content: I first made this cake for a family birthday, and the rich aroma of chocolate mingled with cherry liqueur instantly filled the kitchen with warmth. Watching everyone’s faces light up with each bite made it a truly memorable experience that I cherish.

• Main ingredient: All-purpose flour and unsweetened cocoa powder create the perfect moist and tender cake base; be sure to sift for a smooth batter.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds authentic cherry liqueur flavor that elevates the cake; use good quality for best taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bing cherries provide natural sweetness and texture, while heavy cream whips into a luscious frosting.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, mixing bowls, electric mixer, parchment paper, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat oven and prepare pans with parchment. Sift dry ingredients for even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then add eggs and vanilla. Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to keep batter light.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Bake the batter evenly in two pans until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely before slicing layers horizontally to create four thin layers. Soak each layer with kirschwasser for moistness and flavor.
Finishing Touches:
Prepare the buttercream filling and spread between layers with cherries. Whip the cream with vanilla and kirschwasser to frost the cake. Garnish with delicate chocolate curls for a stunning finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure cakes are fully cooled before slicing to prevent crumbling.
  • Do not overwhip cream to avoid grainy texture.
  • Visual cue: cake layers should be moist but hold shape after soaking.
  • Store covered in refrigerator; best enjoyed within 2 days. Rewhip cream slightly if needed before serving.

structured_content.content: This cake has become a beloved tradition in my family, bringing everyone together to share stories and laughter over its rich, comforting flavors. It’s more than dessert—it’s a celebration of togetherness.

Enhance the cherry flavor by adding a splash of cherry juice to the filling or frosting. For a deeper chocolate taste, fold in finely chopped dark chocolate into the whipped cream. Fresh cherries can replace canned for a seasonal twist.

Serve slices with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of dessert wine. Pair with simple vanilla ice cream or fresh berries for a refreshing contrast. Ideal for birthdays, holidays, or elegant afternoon tea.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can use coconut cream whipped with powdered sugar and non-dairy butter substitutes. Swap kirschwasser with cherry juice or brandy for alcohol-free options.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use room temperature ingredients for smoother batter and better rise.
  • Chill cake layers briefly before slicing to get clean cuts.
  • Brush kirschwasser evenly with a pastry brush to avoid soggy spots.
  • Pipe whipped cream edges for a professional finish.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in your kitchen repertoire, you’ll gain confidence to create stunning, flavorful cakes that impress every time. Enjoy the process and the joy of sharing a truly special dessert with loved ones.
